page.title: 03Economics of farming.
page.content: The farmer we interviewed told us that there were eleven farms in the area thirty years ago. Now there are only three. Many small farms have disappeared or joined together. He says it is harder to make money these days. One reason being the Quota for milk that has been agreed by the European Common Market. Each farmer is only allowed to produce so much milk and any extra can't be sold. Our farmer before knowing about the quota had invested 27,000 pounds on new barns and equipment so they could have more cows. Now the new barns and equipment are no use.
